title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
synopsis: A young girl grows up in the racially charged Depression-era South and learns about compassion and justice through her father's example.

author: George Orwell
synopsis: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance, censorship, and torture to control its citizens.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
synopsis: A classic romantic comedy about the manners and matrimony in early 19th century England.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
synopsis: A novel about the American dream and the disillusionment of the Jazz Age, centered around the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
synopsis: The narrative of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to revenge himself on the whale that 'reaped' his leg.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
synopsis: An epic novel that intertwines the lives of private and public individuals during the time of the Napoleonic wars.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
synopsis: A story about the life of a cynical teenage boy who recently got expelled from his fourth school.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
synopsis: Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit, embarks on a journey with dwarves to reclaim a treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
synopsis: An orphaned girl becomes a governess and falls in love with her employer, Mr. Rochester, who has a dark secret.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
synopsis: An epic fantasy trilogy about the quest to destroy a powerful ring and save Middle-earth.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
synopsis: A shepherd boy named Santiago travels from Spain to Egypt in search of a treasure, learning life lessons along the way.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
synopsis: A dystopian novel about a future society that achieves happiness through technological advancements and rigid social control.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
synopsis: A story of the Joad family who are forced off their land during the Great Depression and travel to California seeking a better life.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
synopsis: A psychological drama about a poor ex-student who murders a pawnbroker and wrestles with his conscience.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
synopsis: A tragic love story set on the Yorkshire moors between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
synopsis: A scientist creates a sentient creature in an unorthodox experiment, leading to tragic consequences.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
synopsis: A story of friendship and redemption set against the backdrop of a changing Afghanistan.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
synopsis: The life and growth of an orphan named Pip, and the people who shape his journey.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
synopsis: A story about the life of a cynical teenage boy who recently got expelled from his fourth school.

title: Little Women
author: Louisa May Alcott
synopsis: The lives and struggles of the four March sisters during the American Civil War.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
synopsis: A future society where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
synopsis: A young man sells his soul for eternal youth and beauty, leading to his moral decay.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
synopsis: A young girl in Nazi Germany finds solace by stealing books and sharing them with others.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
synopsis: A novel about the vampire Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
synopsis: A post-apocalyptic novel about a father and son's journey through a desolate world.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
synopsis: The multi-generational story of the Buendia family in the town of Macondo.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
synopsis: A dystopian novel about a theocratic society where women are oppressed and used for reproduction.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
synopsis: A series of fantasy novels about the adventures of children in the magical land of Narnia.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
synopsis: A tragic love story between a married aristocrat and a young officer in imperial Russia.

title: Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
synopsis: A satirical novel about the absurdities of war and bureaucracy, centered on a group of World War II bomber pilots.

title: Gone with the Wind
author: Margaret Mitchell
synopsis: A novel about the life of Scarlett O'Hara during the American Civil War and Reconstruction era.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
author: Kurt Vonnegut
synopsis: A novel about the experiences of a soldier who becomes 'unstuck in time' and witnesses the bombing of Dresden.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
synopsis: A novel about a former slave haunted by the ghost of her dead daughter.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
synopsis: A young boy and a runaway slave travel down the Mississippi River on a raft.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
synopsis: A story of betrayal, revenge, and redemption involving a young sailor falsely imprisoned.

title: Memoirs of a Geisha
author: Arthur Golden
synopsis: A fictional account of a geisha's life in 20th century Japan.

title: The Secret Garden
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
synopsis: A young orphan girl discovers a hidden, neglected garden and brings it back to life.

title: The Metamorphosis
author: Franz Kafka
synopsis: A man wakes up to find himself transformed into a giant insect, leading to his alienation from society.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
synopsis: A novel about the struggles and redemption of an ex-convict, set against the backdrop of post-revolutionary France.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
synopsis: A young Indian boy survives a shipwreck and shares a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger.

title: Rebecca
author: Daphne du Maurier
synopsis: A young woman marries a widower and is haunted by the memory of his first wife.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
synopsis: A novel set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution, highlighting the lives of several characters.

title: A Clockwork Orange
author: Anthony Burgess
synopsis: A dystopian novel about a teenage delinquent who undergoes an experimental form of aversion therapy.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
synopsis: A family stays at an isolated hotel where the father descends into madness and supernatural forces are at play.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
synopsis: A young girl grows up in the racially charged Depression-era South and learns about compassion and justice through her father's example.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
synopsis: A young boy discovers he is a wizard and attends a magical school, where he makes friends and enemies.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
synopsis: A dystopian novel about a teenage girl who participates in a deadly televised competition.

title: Ender's Game
author: Orson Scott Card
synopsis: A young boy is trained to become a military leader in a war against an alien species.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
synopsis: A symbologist and a cryptologist uncover a secret society and a conspiracy involving the Catholic Church.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
synopsis: A journalist and a hacker investigate the disappearance of a wealthy man's niece, uncovering dark family secrets.
